title: Persimmon Cookies
author: Louise
directions: Preheat oven to 350°. Dissolve soda in fruit pulp, cream together butter and sugar, add eggs one at a time. Sift together dry ingredients. Add dry ingredients to cream mixture. stir well. Add nuts and raisins plus the persimmon pulp. drop by spoonful on greased cookie sheet. Bake about 10-12 minutes.

title: Peanut Butter Fudge
author: Begley
ingredients: 1 3/4 cup marshmellow cream (may use 1 jar kraft marsh. cream)
directions: Cook sugar, milk, marshmallow cream & butter in a sauce pan. Cook and stir over low heat until blended. Cook over medium heat for exactly 5 minutes. remove and add peanut butter, vanilla & peanuts. Let set up in refrigerator until hard.

title: See's Fudge Candy
author: Original
directions:
Mix sugar and milk. Boil 7-8 min, stirring often. Bring to a rolling boil. In a large bowl 3 pkgs of choco chips, 7 oz jar of marshmallow cream, 1/2 lb melted butter. Cream butter & marshmallow together and add choco chips. Pour hot mixture over choco chip mixture. after it has melted add 2 cup of nuts & 1 tsp of vanilla, blend well, pour into buttered pans and chill. Cut into squares before firm.
Note: This was given to Amy DeVore by Emma Julian c.1930, this is supposedly the original recipe for See's Fudge, produced by the company in Los Angeles. Emma worked for See's and later owned her own candy store.

title: Hazel's Sugar Cookies
author: Louise
directions: Cream sugars, oil, butter, eggs, vanilla. Add dry ingredients and mix thoroughly. Chill several hours. Roll into balls and dip into sugar then place onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes or until light brown around edges.

title: Lemon Bread
author: Hunkie
directions: Preheat oven to 350°. Mix lemon cake mix, vanilla instant pudding, water, eggs, & oil together. place in bread pan and sprinkle with poppy seeds. bake for 30-40 minutes or until knife inserted into cake is clean.

title: Corn Bread
author: Hunkie
directions: Preheat oven to 400°. Melt 1 cube of butter (Nucoa) and pour into pan. Mix corn meal, buttermilk, eggs, soda & salt thoroughly. Pour into pan and bake for about 45 minutes or until knife is clean after inserted into the center of the corn bread.

title: New Orleans Sheat Cake
author: Hunkie
directions:
Place water, Nucoa, cocoa and oil on stove until Nucoa melts. Remove from stove and let cool. Beat eggs & Sugar add oil, Nucoa, water and cocoa. Stir in dry ingredients and add buttermilk. Bake on a cookie sheet pan. Bake at 375° for 15-20 minutes check at 15 minutes.
Icing: On stove top melt Nucoa & add milk and vanilla, pour onto powdered sugar and cocoa mix until all the lumps are out. Spread onto cake.

title: Snickerdoodles
author: Hunkie
directions: In large mixing bowl add Shortening, eggs & sugar. Cream together then add cream of tartar, soda and salt slowly mix in flour. Chill dough in fridge. Mix together 2 tsp of sugar and 2 tsp of cinnamon. Roll dough into balls and roll in bowl of cinnamon and sugar. Place on greased cookie sheet @ 400° for 8-10 minutes.

title: Bread Pudding
author: Hunkie
directions: Place bread in a baking dish, mix the rest of the ingredients together and pour over bread and sprinkle with Nutmeg. Place baking dish in a larger deep pan of water while baking in oven. Bake 350° for 1 hour.

title: Lemon Bars
author: Hunkie
directions:
Crust - Cream butter in a bowl until lite and soft, add sugar and beat in flour and powdered sugar. It will be dry, spray 9*13 pan with Pam press dough into the baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes @ 350°.
Filling- Beat 4 Eggs, 2 cups Sugar, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/2 cup lemon juice, 2 Tbls of lemon zest and beat until creamy. Beat until Lite and creamy for 20 minutes @ 350° Let cool and then cut into bars.

title: Egg Noodles
author: Hunkie
directions: Mix all ingredients together. Roll in a ball. Place on floured bread board. Roll dough until thin for noodles. cut into thin strips. Start water boiling in a big pot. Place noodle strips a few at a time in pot and cook until tender.

title: Fume Salad
author: Hunkie
directions: Mix onion and cabbage in bowl. Brown almonds and sesame seeds in a frying pan. Add almonds and sesame seeds to cabbage mixture along with crushed uncooked noodles. Dressing Mix in seperate bowl sugar, vingar, salt, pepper & salad oil. After blended pour over salad mixture coating thoroughly.

title: Peanut Butter Cookies (Louise)
author: Louise
directions: Preheat oven to 375° In a large bowl cream together sugars, butter, Crisco, peanut butter, eggs, & vanilla. Sift together dry ingredients. Add slowly to the creamed mixture until all is added. Then add the peanut butter chips. Drop by a teaspoon on a greased cookie sheet. cook for 8-10 minutes or until just brown around the edges.

title: Peanut Butter Cookies (Hunkie)
author: Hunkie
directions: Preheat oven to 375° Cream shortening, sugars, egg, vanilla, peanut butter. Sift together all dry ingredients and slowly add to cream mixture. Add coconut last then turn out onto floured bread board. Roll into a log and chill for 1 hour. Slice and bake on a greased cookie sheet. Bake 8-10 minutes

title: Sandwich Cookies
author: Marge Glanville
ingredients: 1/2 cup powdered sugar (I used about 3/4 c)
directions:
Preheat oven to at 375° Mix the first 3 ingredients together. slowly add the flour and then roll in balls about the size of marbles. Press down with a fork. Bake about 8-10 minutes or till just tan. Put together with frosting and let set.
Frosting: Melt Nucoa and pour into powdered sugar stir or beat with mixer. add egg yolk & vanilla

title: Hummingbird Cake
author: Hunkie
directions: Preheat oven to at 350° Combine first five ingredients and mix well. Using a stir spoon and not a mixer, stir in eggs & oil until well mixed. Add vanilla, pineapple, & Pecans. Turn out into a greased and floured pan and bake for about 25-30 minutes. For icing use cream cheese icing

title: Cheesecake
author: Hunkie
directions:
Preheat oven to 375° In a large bowl cream the cream cheese until smooth. add egg and sugar mix well. Add vanilla, lemon juice and sour cream. Pour into graham cracker crust and bake until set about 45 minutes.
Topping Mix: sour cream, sugar & vanilla or lemon juice and pour out onto pie and continue to bake for about 5 minutes more.

title: Lemon Meringue Pie
author: Hunkie
directions:
Boil sugar and water until dissolved. In a bowl combine corn starch, 1/2 cup water, 4 egg yolks (save the whites for later), lemon juice & butter. Add sugar and water mixture stirring until it becomes thick. Pour out into a precooked pie shell and let sit.
Meringue Topping: Beat together 4 egg whites, 8 tbsp sugar until you have stiff peaks. Pour out onto the top of the pie and broil for just a few minutes to give a nice light brown color to the top.

title: Basic Cream Pie
author: Hunkie
directions:
In a saucepan mix sugar & cornstarch. Add milk and cook until mixture becomes thick. You will need to keep stirring until this happens. Remove from heat and add butter and egg yolks. Return to stove top and cook another 2-3 minutes. Remove from stove top and add vanilla and cool. Pour into baked pie shell.
For the following:
Banana cream pie: add two sliced bananas
Chocolate: melt 2 sq of bakers chocolate.
Coconut: add 1 cup of coconut flakes

title: Rocky Road Squares
author: Hunkie
directions: Melt Chocolate chips, eagle brand milk and butter over hot water. Add nuts and marshmallows. Spread on waxed paper in a 13x9 in pan. chill 2 hrs. Peel off waxed paper and cut into squares

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
author: Hunkie
directions: Preheat oven to 375° In a bowl cream together butter, sugars, eggs & vanilla. Sift together flour, salt & soda. Add chocolate chips and nuts. Drop onto greased cookie sheet and bake for 8-10 minutes or just until brown around the edges.

title: Divinity Candy
author: Hunkie
directions: In a saucepan combine sugar, syrup, salt, vanilla & water. Cook until you reach 236° or soft ball stage. Reserve 1/2 cup of mixture to use in egg whites. Beat egg whites. Add the 1/2 cup syrup mixture to the egg whites and mix altogether. Cook remainder to hard stage.

title: Mexican Wedding Cookies
author: Hunkie
directions: Preheat oven to 400° Cream butter and sugar together with vanilla. Slowly add flour and salt to the mixture. Form into round balls and bake for 10-12 minutes

title: English Toffee
author: Hunkie
directions: In pan melt butter and sugar and cook to a hard crack stage. Grease cookie sheet before you start. Put 1/2 nuts and 1/2 chocolate chips on cookie sheet. Pour caramel mixture over this and add chocolate chips and nuts on top of it. Let stand until hardens and then tap on it to break into bite size pieces.

title: Scalloped Potatoes
author: Hunkie
directions: Make sauce first. Melt butter, then add flour and milk, salt and pepper. cook until thick then add cheese if desired. Next peel and thinly slice potatoes adding them to the mixture. Cook potatoes until about 1/2 done. Then take potatoes and layer in greased 9x13 baking dish. Add thinly sliced onion layered on top of the potatoes. Cover with sauce and bake covered at 350° until nearly done. Remove top and let brown.

title: Hearty Vegetable Soup
author: Hunkie
ingredients: 4 slices of bacon cooked and drained
directions: In a large saucepan, saute bacon and add celery, carrots and onion and saute for another 3 minutes. Add potatoes, broth and bullion cubes. Simmer until potatoes are soft. Add corn and half and half with flour. stir until blended. continue to cook for another 2 minutes.

title: Kentucky Biscuits
author: Hunkie
directions: Mix yeast and warm water and let sit. Sift together flour, soda, sugar, baking powder & salt. Put into this 3/4 cup shortening and add 2 cup buttermilk. Add yeast mixture. Work until well moistened. Put into greased bowl and set in refrigerator. When your ready to use some, pinch off in balls and let rise until doubles. Bake 400° for 12 minutes. Keep in refrigerator until all used.

title: Everlasting Rolls
author: Hunkie
ingredients: 1 tbsp salt mixed with 1 cup flour
directions: Placer milk, sugar and shortening in pan on stove and bring to boil. Remove and allow to cool, Dissolve yeast in lukewarm water. Add this to above mixture along w/ approx 4 cup flour, to make a cakelike batter. Set aside. Allow to rise until twice as big. After dough rises, combine baking powder and salt w/ 1 cup flour & add to dough. Work in enough more flour to make a soft dough. Refrigerate. This will keep for a week. Ready to use? Pinch off what you need and shape as desire. Lit rise. Bake at 400° until brown

title: Aebleskivers
author: Hunkie
directions: Separate the eggs and beat the whites stiff. Mix all the other ingredients together at one time. Beat until smooth. Fold in egg whites. Use about 1 tsp oil in the bottom of each hot aebleskiver pan cups.  Pour in about 2 tbsp of batter in each cup. As soon as they are bubbly around the edges, turn quickly using an ice pick or a wooden dowel.

title: Mile High Bisquits
author: Hunkie
directions: Sift dry ingredients. cut in shortening. Combine egg and milk. Mix with dry ingredients. Kneed lightly and roll out to 1 inch thick. Melt 1/2 stick Nucoa in 8x8 pan. Roll bisquit in margarine. Let rest approx 10 minutes. Bake 450° for 12-15 minutes

title: Piroski
author: Gladys Phillips
directions: Cream butter and cream cheese together. Add flour. Turn out onto a bread board and roll to 1/8" thick. Cut into 3" rounds. Filling Saute a little less than 1 lb of ground beef. add 1 minced onion, a pinch of dill, salt and pepper and 2 tbsp butter. Cook for about 5 minutes. Add 1 4oz can of mushrooms and 2 boiled eggs chopped very fine. Put small amount of this mixture in each 3" round and fold over. Crimp edges, chill for 2 hours. bake in preheated oven at 450° for 12 minutes.

title: Hawiian Pie
author: Hunkie
directions: Preheat oven to 400° Combine all ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Bake in an uncooked pie shell. Cook for about 45 minutes or until pie is set.

title: Pinapple White Fudge
author: Hunkie
directions: Cook syrup, sugar and butter, to 236° on a candy thermometer or to a soft ball stage. Pour over nuts and marshmallows in a large bowl. Beat until thick. Drop by top on wax paper.

title: Peanut Butter Penuche
author: Hunkie
directions: Bring the sugars, milk and baking soda to a boil in a saucepan over medium high heat, stirring constantly. Continue heating until the temp reaches 236° on a candy thermometer about 25 minutes, or until it will form a soft ball when dropped into cold water. Take pot off of fire and add peanut butter and vanilla stirring till blended. Set the saucepan on a wire rack to cool and don't disturb it until the temp has dropped to 110 °, or until you can barely hold your hand to the bottom of the pan. Beating it to soon will cause grainier candy. After it has cooled add peanuts. Turn out into a buttered pan to set. A New Orleans Candy treat!!!

title: Red Lobster Biscuits
author: Hunkie
directions: Mix bisquick, milk and cheese together. Drop into buttered baking dish. Bake at 400° for 10-12 minutes or until Golden Brown. Melt Butter and add 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp pepper and 1 tsp of garlic, brush on top of biscuits.

title: Red Cabbage
author: Hunkie
directions: Melt butter and saute onions and apples add rest of ingredients except cabbage. cook on medium until mixture boils. Add sliced cabbage and simmer on medium until tender.

title: Andrews Traditional Thanksgiving Salad
author: Hunkie
ingredients: 2 small or 1 large box Orange Jello
directions: Place Jello in bowl and add hot water. Stir until completely dissolved. Add apricot juice, apricots, pinapple. After jello starts to firm up add marshmallows. Place in refrigerator and let set up, about 1 hour. Combine sugar, flour, apricot juice, and butter and place over low heat until thickened. cool, then fold in 1 cup of whipped cream. After Jello has firmed up place topping mixture on top and replace in refrigerator until entire mixture is firm.

title: The Chart House Bleu Cheese Dressing
author: Hunkie
directions: Blend 2 minutes at low speed. Add 1 1/3 cup mayonnaise. Then add by hand 4 oz bleu cheese. Place in refrigerator till cold.

title: 8 Layer Mexican Dip
author: Hunkie
directions: Before layering mix the 3 avacodos with the 3 tbsp of lemon juice and set aside, then mix the 1/2 package of taco seasoning mix with 6 tbsp of sour cream and set aside. In a deep serving dish start to layer each ingredient starting with the bean dip. Serve with tortilla chips

title: Ribbon Salad
author: Hunkie
directions: In a large bowl dissolve the 2 pkgs of lime Jello with 2 cup of hot water. After dissolved add 2 cup of cold water. Pour into a 14 x 10 inch pan. Place in refrigerator and chill just until partially set up. Dissolve 1 pkg of lemon Jello with 1 cup of hot water. Add marshmallows and stir until marshmallows are melted. Add 1 cup drained pineapple juice and cream cheese. With mixer beat until blended. Add crushed pineapple stir completely. Fold in mayonnaise and whipped cream. Chill until thickened. After thickened pour gently over lime layer. Next dissolve 2 packages of strawberry Jello with 2 cup hot water. After dissolved add 2 cup cold water, Chill mixture until thickened then pour over pineapple layer and chill until firm

title: Peanut Brittle
author: Kaisers
directions: Preheat oven to 400°. Place peanuts onto a buttered cookie sheet and let sit. Pour sugar into large saucepan. Add Karo syrup, salt and vanilla. Cook on high for approximatley 8 minutes at a full boil stirring constantly. Add 1 tsp of soda and pour onto buttered cookie sheet pan immediately over peanuts. Let sit until hard. After mixture has set up break up into bite size pieces.

title: Gingersnaps
author: Hunkie
directions: Cream sugar, shortening and egg until smoth. Add the rest of the ingredients. drop by spoon on cookie sheet. Bake 400° until light brown approx 8-10 minutes. Let cool and place cookies on cake rake to cool. Can be doubled without any problems

title: Half & Half / Pinwheel Cookies
author: Hunkie
directions: Preheat oven to 400°. After making Ethel's cookie dough with the vanilla divide dough in 1/2. Melt chocolate squares and add to 1/2 of the dough mixture & chill. With remaining dough (white) place in 12x9 buttered dish. Place the chocolate dough on top of the white. Roll together tightly beginning @ the wide side of the dough. Chill together 1 hour. slice and bake on buttered cookie sheet. Half & Half Follow recipe above for the pinwheel dough. Instead of rolling dough together, shape halfs together chill, slice and bake.

title: Ethel's Sugar Cookies
author: Hunkie
directions: Preheat oven to 400°. Mix shortening, sugar, eggs & vanilla. In a separate bowl mix flour, salt & baking powder. Add slowly to creamed mixture until blended. Chill mixture for 1 hour. Turn mixture out onto floured bread board and roll about 18" thick. Cut out cookies and place on buttered cookie sheet and cook for about 6-8 minutes or until golden brown.

title: Rice Pudding
author: Loiuise
directions: Preheat oven to 300°. Mix first 6 ingredients thoroughly. Pour into buttered glass dish about a 9x13. Dot with butter and sprinkle with nutmeg. Place baking dish in a larger shallow pan containing about 1 inch water. Bake slowly for about 1 hour or until set.

title: Apple Crisp
author: Hunkie
directions: Preheat oven to 375°. Peel apples and slice. Put in 8x8 buttered pan. In a bowl mix flour, sugar and cinnamon together. Slice butter into squares and cut into flour mixture until crumbly. Sprinkle on top of apples. Bake for about 45 minutes. (Macintosh apples are preferred but any kind will do)

title: Pancakes
author: Loiuise
directions:
Heat skillet on medium heat. Sift flour and rest of dry ingredients together. cream egg & oil. Mix all ingredients with buttermilk.
**Note-for thinner pancakes mix in a little more buttermilk. spray heated pan with non-stick spray and enjoy.

title: Hot Chicken Salad
author: Hunkie
directions: Preheat oven to 400 °. Mix all ingredients except potatoe chips & cheese. Place chicken mixture in a 13x9 casserole dish. Top with grated cheese & potatoe chips. Bake about 25 minutes.
